C++ - Namespace

Created:2018-02-12  Last modified:2018-02-12

  • Introduction
  • Namespace

  1. Introduction

    Namespace keeps program name clean. Program can define functions that have the same name but in different namespace.

  2. Namespace

    Define/specify namespace

    namespace name{// this scope is under the a namespace}

    Specify namespace

    using namespace name; // the file is under the namespace

    A file can have multiple namespaces, a namespace can be mentioned in a couple of files

    The header file's class declaration and source file's class implementation must in the same namespace.

    The main function cannot be placed in any namespace.

    Example

    // .h file
namespace H {

class F{
 public:
  void print();
};

}  // namespace H
namespace K {

class F{
 public:
  void print(){
    std::cout << "K-F" << std::endl;
  }
};

}  // namespace K

    // .cc file
namespace H {

void F::print(){
    std::cout << "H-F" << std::endl;
}

}  // namespace H

int main(){
  H::F f;
  K::F e;
  f.print();
  e.print();
}
